title: Sr. Salesforce Marketing Cloud Consultant
content:
About the Role
Media.Monks is a digital-first marketing and advertising services company that connects content, data and digital media and technology services and produces websites, games, films, social media content, digital advertising campaigns, data and measurement solutions, and more.
*C360.Monks — a branch of Media.Monks, is a trusted Salesforce Consulting Partner and MuleSoft Partner, helping organizations grow faster and create deeper customer connections with Salesforce.
Our new Sr. Salesforce Marketing Cloud Consultant will be responsible for building and leading our Salesforce Marketing Cloud practice, assisting sales and project management to ensure customer success. This role will work closely with Salesforce and Media Monk’s other business channels helping to educate members, share expertise, and be instrumental in helping to grow the Salesforce Marketing Cloud practice. The ideal candidate will have experience coming up through the practitioner and consultant ranks, executing email marketing campaigns and an understanding of data integration into/out of Email Service Providers (ESP) as well as have strong presentation and interpersonal skills.
Responsibilities:

Lead the capability which is responsible for the implementation of SFDC Marketing Cloud services including Journey Builder, Audience, Email, Social Studios or equivalent services.
Support Sales in partnership with Salesforce on new business opportunities
Work closely with Analytics and Data teams to provide a best-in-class SF and Google integration services which leverage the best that both platforms can offer for the Advertiser/Marketer
Lead complex targeting and personalization strategies, utilizing informed data points to develop advanced segmentation decisions
Collaborate with other business channels to devise appropriate cross-channel efforts and communication streams
Proactively research and identify opportunities to further drive revenue through customer campaigns and improve marketing efficiencies

 
About You
The essentials:

Salesforce certified with a minimum of 2 years of experience in SFMC implementations.
Demonstrable experience in email/customer marketing, CRM, analytics or equivalent Cross -channel business acumen
Passionate about leveraging data to achieve business outcomes
Highly proficient with marketing technologies (specifically campaign management, data management platforms); general knowledge of HTML
Proven ability to learn from others as well as develop, and mentor a team 
Excellent customer service/people skills
Communicate effectively both verbal/written
Ability to work flexible/ various shifts
Possess/maintain analytical/problem-solving skills
Exercises substantial latitude in determining objectives and approaches to critical assignments.

Not a must, but a plus:

Expertise in Evergage or Pardot
Prior experience at a Salesforce Partner company

At Media.Monks, we believe in fostering an environment where a diversity of perspectives can thrive. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission.  
 
What We Offer
Media.Monks has provided a compensation range that represents its good faith estimate of what Media.Monks may pay for the position at the time of posting. Media.Monks may ultimately pay more or less than the posted compensation range. The salary offered to the selected candidate will be determined based on job-related factors, but not based on a candidate’s sex or any other protected status.
National Salary Range
$130,000 — $150,000 USD
 
Benefits

Excellent, full coverage medical, dental, and vision insurance with employer-paid HRA
Unlimited PTO and 15 company-wide holidays
401k with company contribution
Paid parental leave
Work-life balance with an emphasis on personal well-being with subscriptions to Headspace, employee assistance program, and access to fitness apps
Lifestyle Spending Account (LSA) for you to use on financial and emotional well-being programs
Career growth in a disruptor space & entrepreneurial opportunities within the Media.Monks network 
A globally diverse & inclusive culture with employee resource groups such as S4 Melanin, Pride.Monks, Cultura.Monks, and more!
Authentic commitment to DEI efforts and sustainable growth. (Why Sir Martin Sorrell signed The Climate Pledge here!)

 
#LI-JA1
#LI-REMOTEAbout Media.Monks:
Media.Monks is the purely digital operating brand of S4Capital plc that connects 8,600+ digital natives across one global team. We are united by a mission to shift industries forward and pave the path towards ambitious outcomes so our clients and our people can realize their full potential for growth. Our unified model combines solutions in media, data, social, platforms, studio, experience, brand and technology services to help our clients continuously reinvent themselves throughout increasingly rapid cycles of disruption. Our efforts to shape culture, build innovative technologies and unlock the future of growth have earned recognition from numerous esteemed panels: we maintain a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-22), regular recognition at Cannes Lions, inclusion in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players (2020-23), the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-23), a record number of FWAs, and have earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023. Together, these achievements solidify our experience in digital innovation, excellence in craft, and commitment to personal growth.
While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Media.Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://media.monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.
Disclaimer: 


Responsible for resourcing and implementing security controls for your teams processes and systems


Responsible that all your personnel apply information security in accordance with the established information security policy

demographic_questions.description:
Media.Monks does not  discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, age, gender identity and expression, sexual identity, marital status, veteran status, or disability.

At Media.Monks, we believe in fostering an environment where a diversity of perspectives can thrive. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission. 

As a step in strengthening our hiring process, we invite you to voluntarily provide demographic information that will help inform and improve our inclusion efforts.

As a reminder, answering these questions is entirely voluntary. Your responses will remain confidential and intended solely for the purpose of improving our hiring process; and will not, in any way, be associated with your specific application or be used in the hiring decision.
